fields.description:
h5. Description

After enabling _Site Support Address_ in {{confluence.cfg.xml}} by referring to [this documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Support+Address] and click save, the changes do not apply, it still appearing as the default email address, which is {{autosupportrequests@atlassian.com}}.

A query with the following SQL does not return any result for {{<supportRequestEmail>}}:

{code:sql}
SELECT BANDANAVALUE FROM BANDANA WHERE BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.settings';
{code}

h5. Workaround

# Stop Confluence.
# Go to _/<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib_ and locate {{confluence-<confluence_version>.jar}}.
# Edit the JAR archive by referring to the following link:
-- [Editing Files within JAR Archives|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+Files+within+JAR+Archives]
# Edit {{external-links.properties}} which should be available inside the JAR archive.
# Change the email for the attribute {{mailto.confluence.auto.support.requests}} to your desire email.
# Start Confluence.
fields.summary: Changes is not applied when editing the Site Support Address

fields.description:
Please make a privilege for page reordering that could be assigned separately from the page edit privilege.

We have an open source community with a wide variety of skills using Confluence. While we try to encourage our community  to edit and add content to the wiki, we would prefer to limit organization of the content to a smaller group of people (to ensure a consistent organization of pages in the wiki). fields.description:
Current situation is:

The new User object now has a directory ID and is tied to a specific directory. However, the Crowd API amalgamates users across directories based on username, so you can (almost) never see a user that exists in a secondary directory with the same name as one in the first. So you can only log in as the user in the first directory.

Confluence internal code only processes 'username' in its API, and not specifically domain and username. Within the new user management code,  users are identified by ID, which is unique for a user+domain.

The problem is that same usernames across different domains will lead to 'shadow user' issue.
fields.summary: Support Active Directory Domain Differentiation for usernames.

fields.description:
The [Custom Query mappers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+V2+search+API] modules are not getting loaded once the server is restarted.

This is causing a [serious problem in Ad hoc Workflows|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/APRV-392]. The workaround is [manually reloading the lucene-query-mapper modules|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/APRV-392?focusedCommentId=40949&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-40949].

h3. Recreating the problem:
* When the plugin containing the {{lucene-query-mapper}} modules is installed, no problem, everything works
* When the server is restarted, trying to access the query causes an exception like this one:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.LuceneMapperNotFoundException: A lucene mapper could not be found to map an object of type: com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.SearchQuery and key: workflowassignee
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.BooleanQueryMapper.addSubQueries(BooleanQueryMapper.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.BooleanQueryMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(BooleanQueryMapper.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.java:30)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.debugQuery(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:138)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.makeEntries(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:131)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.createDashboardReport(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:78)
{noformat}

*Please note that this is a confluence issue, which happens to have an effect in Ad hoc Workflows*

fields.description:
Although we don't officially support PostgreSQL 9.0, I've been using it locally for development. The only problem I've hit so far is that installing a plugin into Confluence fails with an unknown error in the UI.

bq. An unexpected error occurred

This is because the JDBC drivers we ship with Confluence have a problem with the BLOB data in PostgreSQL 9.0. To work around the problem, you can download the latest JDBC drivers.

We should update the version of the drivers we ship in Confluence to [9.0-801.jdbc3|http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/postgresql/postgresql/9.0-801.jdbc3/], which is already available in the central Maven repository.
fields.summary: Can't install plugin in Confluence with PostgreSQL 9.0

fields.description:
When retrieving users, groups and memberships from an LDAP server, Confluence binds (authenticates) to LDAP with the configured username and password. It would be good to support anonymous binds to the LDAP server for these operations.

Note that Confluence already binds as a different user when authenticating. The authentication process involves a search for the user with the configured bind DN, binding as the specified user, then performing a search for that user's own data.

The necessary changes are just in the UI. We would need to have a checkbox to enable anonymous binds and permit configurations to leave the bind DN and password blank.
fields.summary: Support for anonymous bind to LDAP user management

fields.description:
In Confluence exists a page with the title "Fritz!Box". If this title is entered in the quick search it brings up that page. If the real search is used (searchisite.action) it doesn't bring up that result. If the exclamation mark is escaped with a backslash the site is found.

The search box seems to not escaping those special characters when jumping from the quick search to the real search.

Workaround:

If the page title contains any of the special characters, you need to add \ before that character and you will see the search result. 

So in this case the search should be :{code} Fritz\!Box{code}

fields.description:
This issue is also described in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Start+Confluence+or+Some+Plugins+are+Disabled+upon+Startup

This issue can affect Confluence installed on SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL but most commonly affects SQL Server.

Confluence may fail to start up due to database deadlocks in the Bandana table caused by multi-threaded spring context initialisation.  What happens seems to be:

* The main plugin-thread looks up the general state of the plugin system in bandana, thereby locking the whole bandana table
* That thread spawns separate threads in separate transactions to initialise individual Spring contexts for plugins.
* Some plugins try to look up their own settings in the bandana table during that initialisation but must wait for the main plugin-thread to release the lock.
* Eventually the initalisation of the plugin times out like this:
{noformat}
2011-02-28 14:49:29,366 ERROR [Thread-1] [internal.util.concurrent.RunnableTimedExecution] execute Closing runnable for context NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) did not finish in 10000ms; consider taking a snapshot and then shutdown the VM in case the thread still hangs
{noformat}

This *can* result in Confluence failing to be usable at all, or can result in just those plugins not working.

h3. Patch
We strongly recommend upgrading to Confluence 3.5.9 or newer, which contains a proper fix for this issue. This unsupported patch has only been tested against Confluence 3.3 but should work for other versions up to 3.5.7 as well. If upgrading is not an option, you may follow these steps to patch your version of Confluence:

First, shut down Confluence.

Then, alter the Bandana table to do the following:
* Remove duplicate rows.
* Remove or update any rows with a null bandanacontext value
* Remove or update any rows with a null bandanakey value
* Alter the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns and set them to not null
* Add a unique constraint to the bandana table on the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns
* Drop the band_key_idx index
* Create a new index called band_cont_key_idx on the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns

If running PostgreSQL, you may run the following:
{code:sql}
-- Find duplicate rows, keep only one of each
SELECT b1.* 
FROM BANDANA b1, BANDANA b2 
WHERE b1.BANDANAID <> b2.BANDANAID AND 
b1.BANDANACONTEXT = b2.BANDANACONTEXT AND 
b1.BANDANAKEY = b2.BANDANAKEY 
ORDER BY b1.BANDANACONTEXT, b1.BANDANAKEY, b1.BANDANAID DESC
-- Remove null values
update BANDANA set BANDANACONTEXT = 'CONF22428-NULL-BACKUP' where BANDANACONTEXT is null;
update BANDANA set BANDANAKEY = 'CONF22428-NULL-BACKUP' where BANDANAKEY is null;
-- Add not null constraints
alter table BANDANA alter column BANDANACONTEXT set not null;
alter table BANDANA alter column BANDANAKEY set not null;
-- Add unique constraint
alter table BANDANA add constraint bandana_unique_key unique (BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY);
-- Optimise indexes
drop index band_key_idx;
create index band_cont_key_idx on BANDANA (BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY);
{code}

{panel:title=Warning}
After altering the bandana table as mentioned above, you may have problems upgrading to Confluence 3.5.9 and 3.5.11. We recommend you upgrade to 3.5.12 or above instead.
{panel}

Next, extract the attached patch zip file to your confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory. Ensure that the following files are created:
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$3.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$2.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$1.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceBandanaRecord.hbm.xml
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister$EmptyCachePlaceholder.class

The patch is now applied and you can start Confluence again.

h3. Known workaround for SQL Server
Setting the isolation level of the database as follows is known to fix the issue:
{noformat}
ALTER DATABASE <database name>
   SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON
   WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE;
{noformat}

It's possible there is another fix, such as making the plugin system close its transaction at some stage, or [adding an index to the bandana table|CONF-21985] (since [a lack of appropriate indices in sql server has given us similar issues before|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13668?focusedCommentId=137662&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-137662].
fields.summary: Database deadlock during initialisation of plugins

fields.description:
The most common lookup on the bandana table is to look up entries by context & key together.  However, there is index on this pair of columns, although they both have individual indices.  It would seem better to drop the index on key alone and replace it with one on context + key.

There is a long-standing open issue to create a unique constraint on CONF-7787 which would also make a lot of sense, but may be more difficult since we would have to handle (or delegate to support) any existing duplicates.
fields.summary: Bandana table has no index on context + key

fields.description:
For performance reasons, Active Directory puts an automatic limit on LDAP queries: either 1000 results (on Windows 2000) or 1500 results (on Windows Server 2003). The correct way to retrieve results past this limit is to use the range option, as described here:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/en-us/ldap/ldap/searching_using_range_retrieval.asp

Unless we support this option, group search is broken for groups with more than this limited number of users.
fields.summary: Group membership search breaks with Active Directory's automatic range limiting for large groups

fields.description:
Dynamic groups are broken, but we need to investigate why and how to fix it. This is an important enhancement, as it is a common configuration.

By dynamic groups, we mean the user entry has an 'memberOf' attribute value for each group (as opposed to the group having a 'member' attribute value for each user). Below is a sample LDAP configuration:

dn: cn=mygroup,ou=groups,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: group
ou: groups
cn: mygroup

dn: cn=jsmith,ou=users,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
ou: users
cn: jsmith
memberOf: cn=mygroup,ou=groups,dc=example,dc=com

Note that the 'memberOf' attribute name may vary, and its value can be the full distinguished name (DN) or just the common name (CN) component. This customisation is required for full dynamic group support.
fields.summary: Support memberOf attribute on LDAP users for group membership

fields.description:
Configure Internal User Directory - there is a checkbox to enable nested groups.

This should be removed, as we don't really support nested groups except through external user repositories.

See [EMBCWD-824|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/EMBCWD-824]

fields.description:
Session notes: [https://confxhtml.atlassian.com/display/QA/Targeted+Session+-+Error+Case+(Fede+-+02.01.2011)]

- Add a Read-Write LDAP directory to Jira with one user, synchronize.
- Shutdown the LDAP server

*Expected*: Error message stating that communication error ocurred while contacting remote server, or the raw error message displayed as the error message.

*Case 1*: Adding a group

*Case 2*: Modify a user

I've noticed this on confxhtml notifications but assume it happens in 3.5 too as a result of the new "email pretends to come from a user even though it's actually from the system" feature.

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug
An anchor links that redirect user from an unrestricted page to the restricted page will redirect user to the login page if the user have not login to Confluence yet.
Login URL is like this
{code}
http://localhost:8346/testingpath/login.action?os_destination=/display/Bounce/CSP-xxxxx#CSP-xxxxx-however
{code}
As stated there, the expected behavior that Confluence should take is redirect the user after login. However, although Confluence do redirect the user to the requested page, the anchor link is deleted.
Here is the URL after login.
{code}
http://localhost:8346/testingpath/display/Bounce/CSP-xxxxx
{code} 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set anonymous access on the Global level and Space level on the test instance
# Create anchor link in Page A
# Set view restriction for Page A so that anonymous user can't access it
# Create Page B with the following wiki markup
{code}
[Anchor link|http://<Server Base URL>/display/<Page A space Key>/"PageAtitle"#"PageAtitle"-"anchorname"]
{code}
# Set view permission for Page B so that anonymous user can access it
# Logout
# Access Page B, and click on the Anchor link
# Login

h3. Affected version

||Confluence version||Result||
| 3.1 | (/)|
| 3.2 | (/)|
| 3.3 | (/)|
| 3.4.6 | (/)|
| 3.4.9 | (/)|
fields.summary: Anchor link is not past after login

I'd like to allow internal users anonymous access to confluence, however we'd also like confluence to be externally accessible where anonymous access would be catastrophic.  Currently this means that I've had to disable anonymous logins.

What I'd love is the ability to allow anonymous logins, but only from a set of trusted networks.

fields.description:
If I request a static resource, a session gets created.  For example:

{noformat}
$ curl https://extranet.atlassian.com/images/icons/edit_20.png -D -
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 09 Mar 2011 05:48:48 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Accept-Ranges: bytes
ETag: W/"828-1299108332000"
Last-Modified: Wed, 02 Mar 2011 23:25:32 GMT
Content-Type: image/png
Content-Length: 828
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=DDBD821B57F7CFE373C9B0D73F4C1226; Path=/
Cache-Control: max-age=2419200
Expires: Wed, 06 Apr 2011 05:48:48 GMT
{noformat}

I know sitemesh creates sessions, but does this need to go through sitemesh?  Also, even if it is sitemesh, I'm pretty sure the code that creates a session in sitemesh can be dumped, there's a comment on top of it saying that it has to be done for tomcat 4...  If a session hasn't been created by the time sitemesh needs to access the session, as far as I'm concerned, sitemesh doesn't need to access the session.
fields.summary: HTTP sessions are created when static resources are requested

fields.summary: Allow users to be removed even if they have posted content

fields.description:
In our support policy document, we make it pretty clear that our support for customisations is limited.  Documents like the "custom layouts" page have made this clear for a long time:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF28/Upgrading+Custom+Layouts

It's also clear that CSS customizations aren't supported:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Styling+Confluence+with+CSS

PDF stylesheet customizations are the one area we need to clarify, our documentation doesn't mention that (like CSS and layout customizations) PDF customizations aren't supported:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet

In all three cases, the tone we want to strike is that we support the mechanism, and that we'll help if the mechanism is broken or doesn't work like we say it should in our published examples.  We don't help with implementation details, we refer customers to partners and forums for that.

Ideally, the documentation would make that clear for all types of customisations.
fields.summary: Update wording on PDF customisation page to conform with other customisation docs and support guidelines...

fields.description: The code littered through Confluence to render web items calls the getLabel() method on the descriptor.  However, this method is not defined in the WebItemModuleDescriptor interface and is only found on the ConfluenceWebItemModuleDescriptor implementation.  This means cross-product plugins that instantiate descriptors like Speakeasy must try to detect Confluence and instantiate the Confluence instance as the standard implementation won't work.
fields.summary: Implementions of WebItemModuleDescriptor other than ConfluenceWebItemModuleDescriptor won't render labels

fields.description:
If you try to create an anchor name with an underscore in it, such as "\{anchor:search_results\}," the _ gets removed, and the resultant anchor looks like "#MyPage-searchresults," instead of "#MyPage-search_results."  The anchor should be created as-written, without removing the underscore.

This does not affect links within Confluence pages, as the link will redirect to the anchor with or without the underscore. However it does cause problems when following links form outside of Confluence.
fields.summary: Anchors not working when used in external links

fields.description:
Brad Baker's time zone pref is for Syd and mine is for SF. He posted a [blog|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/2011/03/07/Fedex+0x10+-+16+-+Brown+Bag+Session+on+Thursday+10th+of+March] on EAC. I saw this so then posted a related [blog|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/2011/03/06/Pluggable+Actions+for+Activity+Streams+4.0] on EAC as well. However, because it is March 7 in Syd right now and March 6 in SF, my blog post got listed as having been posted on March 6, and therefore ahead of Brad's blog post which I was replying to.

EAC = Confluence 3.5-rc1
fields.summary: Blog posts are not in chronological order due to time zone preferences

fields.description:
I am not sure if this manifests itself in other combinations of plugins and macros or if it only occurs with the Thin Space character, but I've seen this on customer instances and been able to reproduce locally. This is a new bug we have only seen since upgrading to 3.4.7.


Thin space: http://www.unicodemap.org/details/0x2009/index.html

To reproduce, add this code as wiki markup (you will need to copy and paste to pick up the Thin Spaces after KEY-8):

{code}
{toc} 

h4. Some heading with a JIRA Key KEY-8          

{info:title=Info Macro required for reproduction}
{code}

fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro in combination with the JIRA linking plugin and the info macro can't handle unicode character 0x2009 (thin space)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21934].
  {panel}

Attachment linking macro does create link properly if link tip is used in from blog post:

Steps to reproduce:


Create blog post with the following wiki markup:

[!_test.jpg|align=center,valign=center!|^Test Podcast.avi|tool tip]
it only creates a link back to the blog post itself.

Create a page with the same wiki markup. - it works.


- To make the link work with blog post, you have to remove the tool tip.
[!_test.jpg|align=center,valign=center!|^Test Podcast.avi]
fields.summary: Attachment linking macro does create link properly if link tip is used in from blog post
When trusted apps are updated, keys are not removed from the table

fields.description:
Edit in Office is broken if using *Firefox* when the file is using multi-byte characters, such as Japanese, Chinese or Korean.

This is similar to CONF-16594 where the bug affected pages / spaces with international characters previously.

To replicate, test with this file [^你好吗.doc] and edit in office.

Microsoft Office will open a blank doc, while OpenOffice reports "Error reading data from the internet. Server error message: 500 Internal Server Error."

IE works fine.
fields.summary: Edit in Office fails in Firefox/WebDAV Launcher if file name is using multi-byte characters

I get a error

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on option 'Import Word Document'
2. Select option to 'Split Document' / 'One Heading'

If the word document that you are attaching has the same image as a header across multiple pages the image will appear in the main document but in the child pages an error message is shown. 

The cause of this is that all of the subsequent pages that contain the image are using the same embedded worddav link. Adding the page title to the markup displays the image normally.
fields.summary: Import Word Document Page Split Breaks Duplicate Images Across Pages
Increase the size of the bandana key to 255

fields.description:
h2.Problem
The Popular Labels Macro does not respect the view Restriction. It ignores if the user can or not see this page, and shows all pages with that label to the user. When the user clicks the link it shows "Not Permitted"

h2.Steps to Reproduce
# I've created 2 spaces, Space Good and Space Bad. Then I created 2 labels, good and bad. I've applied this labels to several pages inside their respective spaces.
# I've created a new Space: Test Popular-label-macro. The labels functioned as it should, listed all the "popular" labels.
# Then in one space, I've set view restrictions to the admin user. Thus nobody would be able to see this restricted page.
# Logged out.
# Logged in with a common user.
# Browse to the Test Popular-label-macro Space.
# Could see the Macro working, and could see the link to the restricted page, even if I'm just a common user, but if I do click the link I'm not able to browse, I get a "not permitted"

h2.Fix
There is none yet

h2.Workaround
There is none yet
fields.summary: Popular Labes Macro does not respect view restriction

fields.description: The shortcut key or R for Edit Page Restrictions is not working.
fields.summary: Shortcut Key of R Not Working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21921].
  {panel}

These two new columns have been added in the 3.X upgrade obviously as I do not see them in our legacy 2.X DB (and the CONTENTTYPE column)
In practice the value for the 2 columns is always 0 be it a page watch or space watch.

For some mysterious reason, an existing row was not set to 0/0 for these two columns for ONE page.
All the other ones are good.

The consequence is that when you select the tab "watches" for the user having the watch on the page, it blows up.
(See the exception in the comment).
If I add in the DB the missing 0 for the 'digest', the message will change and it will be the equivalent for the 'network' value.
When the missing 0s are added the issue disappears.
If I remove them, it comes back.

Suggestions:
- investigate how you could not have 0, 0 inserted here. We do not mess up directly with the DB. We use either the UI or the remote API but this page and watch were close to one year old (according to last updated dates), so older than our migration from 2.10.3 to 3.4.X
- add a NOT NULL constraint on these 2 columns new in 3.X AT THE END of the DB upgrade.
- do something in you hibernate mapping to interpret NULL for these two columns as 0.

If you want to reproduce
- have a user watching a page
- edit the row in the NOTIFICATIONS table removing the two 0s
- as this user, click on your profile then go to the watches tab section to see all your watches and it should blow up.

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet#EditingthePDFStylesheet-AddingaTitlePage gives instructions to create a "Title Page", which one would think would be a page by itself. Actually following those instructions will lead to that content being inserted before the table of contents, but not on its own page. Modifying it the html sample as follows puts it on its own page: {code:html}
{code} That may not be the best fix. It's not clear yet to me whether the Doc is wrong and the "page title" just confusingly named, or whether this is a bug. It seems like a bug to me but I'm loathe to insist we change it when people *may* be relying on the existing behaviour of including the table of contents directly after the leading content.
fields.summary: PDF export "title page" is not a page
